result.title: Peer-to-peer Capacity Building on EV innovation - activity report
result.description: To provide the basis for the implementation and provide deeper insights into experiences in different cities, a secondment and staff-exchange programme will be set up in which professionals from local authorities and public transport operators will get the opportunity to work alongside their peers in one of the project´s partner cities. The exchange programme aims to focus on issues beyond technical considerations such as experiences in real world conditions on coalition building, public relations, stakeholder relationships and finance. A direct partnership among cities will be facilitated both at technical and at political level. This way, the good practices and examples of e-mobility will help in avoiding implementation errors and will feed into the toolbox (WP1) and to transferability guidelines (WP6). The SOLUTIONS+ partner cities will be involved in an intense and focused peer-to-peer learning programme. The cities will be grouped in topical clusters depending on the EV use case they are locally developing.

project.title: Integrated Urban Electric Mobility Solutions in the Context of the Paris Agreement, the Sustainable Development Goals and the New Urban Agenda

programme.title: SOCIETAL CHALLENGES - Smart, Green And Integrated Transport

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: InCo flagship on “Urban mobility and sustainable electrification in large urban areas in developing and emerging economies”

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Collaboration framework
result.description: Coaching and matchmakingThe sub-tasks mentioned above will be accompanied by the following coaching activities (interlinked with the tasks on capacity building and on sharing of experience, see WP2):•Linking supply and demand: Based on the local needs assessments, e-mobility solutions identified by Task 3.1 will be adapted to the local contexts in the partner cities, •Mentoring: provide technical expertise and knowledge support to local start-ups to transform innovative ideas into technologically feasible products and services at a local level;•Linking local and international businesses: Exchange between local and international businesses will be facilitated to form business partnerships that can take business models forward, The project team will ensure that information is shared on a fair and impartial basis, respecting intellectual property rights and competition rules. The options will be developed and designed for the benefit of all target groups involved in the respective business model. As the electric vehicle market evolves rapidly and new electric vehicles are regularly introduced, It is likely that not all target group members are aware of the developments. Through this task, a wide spectrum of electric vehicles will be featured, with focus on specific applications for public and shared transport, in particular mini-buses, two-/three-wheelers, vans, cargo-e-bikes, etc.•Matrix /types of business models•Regional needs and capabilities / European contributions•Technical details / specifications guidancePartnerships developed in this task will be in line with the collaboration framework that is developed under this task (D3.2).

project.title: Integrated Urban Electric Mobility Solutions in the Context of the Paris Agreement, the Sustainable Development Goals and the New Urban Agenda

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Twenty (20) city replication roadmaps
result.description: The task is responsible for the link between the toolkit & evaluation (WP1) and demonstration work packages (WP4) at all stages of the city demonstrations. The purpose of the task is twofold: It supports the cities in implementation and development of the demonstration actions by offering the tools and methodologies from WP1 to be applied locally. These tools as well as the business models being developed at city level, the role of this task is to ensure the general usability of the tools and to assess their limits and usage constraints. The task will also ensure coherency and transferability of data, information as well as user needs and acceptance collected from the city demonstrations to be fully exploitable in WP1. The task will be in-co-operation with the WP4 local implementation teams and will work closely with the city and support partners on data gathering, analysis and will provide adjustments to the operations of the demonstration project where necessary. User acceptance of the demonstration innovations will be assessed as part of this task.The demonstration projects s will be assessed by an independent team according to the evaluation framework defined in WP1 (objectives, user needs, KPIs, data gathering and analysis methodology, etc..) to ensure quality and feasibility of such process the local cooperation teams will be involved in the definition of the evaluation framework itself (e.g. selection of the KPIs since they will be collecting the data locally).This common methodology for the development, assessment and reporting of the pilots will ensured as much as possible comparability between the demonstration activities (being aware of the significant differences among them) and allow producing contents and procedures for the transferability of results.

result.title: SOLUTIONSplus Replication Guide
result.description: Aim: Produce a comprehensive guide that encapsulates the holistic learnings from the SOLUTIONSplus project, making it a go-to resource for stakeholders keen on replicating the project's successes.Process:Consolidate all components – from vehicle blueprints to business strategies – into a structured and user-friendly guide.Ensure that the guide addresses the diverse needs of stakeholders – from entrepreneurs to policymakers.Prioritize clarity, actionable insights, and adaptability, ensuring that the guide remains relevant in various regional and operational contexts.D4.7 will provide access to a set of robust and adaptable resources that not only showcase the innovations and successes of the SOLUTIONSplus project but also offer clear guidelines on how to replicate these achievements in their respective contexts

result.title: Risk analysis report
result.description: "Considering the high level of innovations in the expected demonstrations as well as the high number of partners and globally the cities context, it is quite important to set up a continuous risk management in order to follow the probability of occurrence of identified risks or the emergence of new ones.For each WP and each tasks/subtasks a specific risk analysis template will be established; foreseeable risks will be periodically analysed (trimestral if no urgencies) and adequate measurement method of progress will be elaborated (risk indicators) as well as the ""acceptability level"" of each risk. Then the risks analysis will be based on the traditional ""level of impact x probability of occurrence"" approaches (scale 1-5). Periodic risk reports will be analysed by the Steering Group and if necessary, mitigation measures or more drastic decisions will be set up. Outcomes will also be used in the assessments conducted in WP1"

result.title: Business opportunities and partnerships
result.description: In this task, the local businesses and solution providers (including start-ups) in the partner cities are brought together with the European industry partners through a carefully formulated collaboration framework (D3.2). As a first step, a call for local innovators will be launched. Local businesses are encouraged to share knowledge and information, and to develop complementing solutions to the mainstream options already developed by the EU industry partners and catalogued in Task 3.1. Through these complementary solutions, the mainstream options are adapted to the partner city needs. Through a joint effort between the partner cities, local and European industry, business models and plans are developed. Business plans (Task 3.3) will lay out concrete steps to seize business opportunities that have been identified. Therefore, this task will also identify local businesses and specific envisioned services and products relevant for the demonstration actions. This will outline for each start-up the related program elements in the demo activity. It also states their planned deliverables and contributions. In order to enhance the cooperation beyond the consortium, a network will be created with SMEs active in e-mobility in Europe and the partner regions. Through the online catalogue (from Task 3.1) and network-events the potential demand for e-mobility options will be shared with SMEs. Moreover, workshops with SMEs will be organised around convincing concrete business development leads. For many of the fast-growing SMEs it may be difficult to select the right opportunity for cooperation, Hence, the focus lays on robust business development opportunities that match the current needs and potential of local partners. It is foreseen that these network events and workshops result in participation of European SMEs in the demonstration projects, and lead to spin-off partnerships with local companies. SOLUTIONSplus will conduct targeted match-making efforts and project initiations.

result.description: The Ambassadors toolkit is a tool developed during the three sessions dedicated to ambassador training. The toolkit is a structured collection of the ambassadors' experiences and methods to act as promoters of sustainable food chain initiatives. The toolkit contains insights from different countries and food chains.

result.title: IPP Terms of reference
result.description: POLIS will develop the IPP concept and the respective support and technical assistance possibilities in cooperation with WP1 (Identifying the needs of take-up cities); WP2 (Planning-process support); WP3 (Measure support); and WP5 (national take-up), resulting in the IPP‘s detailed Terms of Reference (ToR). These will include detailed objectives; different support formats and concepts; methodologies; timeline; evaluation; and subcontractors selection procedure (including the role of the Agency or EC in confirming each IPP call’s confirmed subcontractors); financing; promotion; and reporting and quality management assurance procedures.

result.title: Call documents
result.description: Call documents (ToR, Frequently Asked Questions) will be made available on the day the call opens, together with an online application form, to enable a smooth application process. A helpdesk to create a direct connection to the IPP management will be established by the task leader. This form will be accessible through the Eltis and SUMPs-Up website. The IPP will allow applications of individual and joint subcontractors.
